# Fence Detection System Tender Announcement

## Tender Details
* **Title:** Fence Detection System
* **Reference Number:** 21120-23-4257441
* **Amendment Number:** 3
* **Solicitation Number:** 21120-23-4257441
* **Publication Date:** May 26, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** June 27, 2023 at 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start and End Dates:** Not specified

## Description
This tender announcement is for the installation of a new fence detection system (FDS) at the Bath Institution, located near Bath, ON, Canada. The FDS will be integrated with the existing Perimeter Intrusion Detection System (PIDS) in the Main Communication and Control Post.

## Trade Agreements
The trade agreement applicable to this procurement is the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Tendering Procedure
All interested suppliers can submit a bid. The tendering procedure is competitive and open to all interested suppliers.

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation criteria for this tender are based on the lowest priced compliant bid.

## Key Requirements
The key requirements of this tender are:

* Installation of a new fence detection system that can detect mechanical vibrations and stress in the fence fabric caused by climbing, cutting, or bridging with climbing devices.
* The fence detection system must have a high probability of detection for all intrusion attempts and a low nuisance alarm rate for fence vibration and stress caused by wind, rain, and snow.

## Mandatory Site Visit
A mandatory site visit is scheduled for June 13, 2023. All bidders are required to confirm their attendance by June 9, 2023.

## Contracting Authority
The Contracting Authority for this tender is Jason St-Onge, whose contact information is as follows:

* Name: Jason St-Onge
* Email: jason.st-onge@csc-scc.gc.ca
* Phone: (506) 269-3765

## Note to Bidders
Bidders can obtain the complete statement of work and evaluation criteria by downloading the solicitation document and associated documents from the Canada buys/tender opportunities website.

The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
